summary: This is a cover letter from the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) to Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, transmitting the OPR Report of Investigation into the Southern District of Florida's handling of the 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. It notes the public release of the Executive Summary and the potential for the full report to be released to Congress or via FOIA.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of the letter and the enclosed OPR report; her office is handling ongoing litigation related to the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Jeffrey R. Ragsdale
persons.role: Director and Chief Counsel of the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility
persons.context: Author and signatory of the letter transmitting the OPR report to Audrey Strauss.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of the federal criminal investigation
persons.context: The individual whose 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida is the subject of the OPR report.

connections.description: Ragsdale, as Director of OPR, is formally transmitting an investigative report to Strauss in her capacity as Acting U.S. Attorney.
Strauss's office (SDNY) is handling ongoing litigation related to Epstein, making the OPR report relevant to her work.

events.title: Federal Criminal Investigation of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The subject of the OPR report, which investigates the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida's resolution of this case and its interactions with victims.

events.title: OPR Report Transmittal and Public Release of Summary
events.description: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility transmits its report to the SDNY and publicly releases the Executive Summary of its investigation into the handling of the Epstein case.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility, 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Suite 3266, Washington, D.C. 20530
United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, New York City, NY 10007
U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (referenced as the subject of the investigation)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed an investigation into how the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida resolved the 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.
The OPR report also investigated the office's interactions with victims during the Epstein investigation.
The Executive Summary of the OPR report was publicly released by the DOJ on November 12, 2020.
The full OPR report was not publicly released at that time but was to be provided to Congress upon request, with Congress having the option to release it publicly.
The report was sent to Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss because it may be relevant to ongoing Epstein-related litigation being handled by her office (SDNY).
